alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:35PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Wheeler, east central Jefferson, Crook, eastern Deschutes, southeastern Union, south central Wallowa and Grant Counties through 430 PM PDT... At 334 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles southeast of Joseph to 6 miles south of Suplee. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... John Day, North Powder, Mitchell, Prairie City, Canyon City, Mount Vernon, Seneca, Long Creek, Dayville, Monument, Granite, Telocaset, Antone, Pondosa, Izee, Hamilton, Suplee, Post, Paulina and Bates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: John Day Basin; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Wallowa County
